intro: Polygala multifurcata, commonly known as the forked milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native range.
